tn.text: These are bowls in which bread is made.

tn.ref: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron
tn.text: "Then Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron"

tn.ref: You can have the privilege of telling me when I should pray for you
tn.text: "You can choose when I will pray for you" or "You can choose the time I should pray for you"
"Pharaoh hardened his heart." Here "hardened" means that he became stubborn. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: just as Yahweh had said that he would do
tn.text: "just as Yahweh had said Pharaoh would do"

tn.ref: This is the finger of God
tn.text: The words "finger of God" represent the power of God. AT: "This is the powerful work of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "heart" refers to Pharaoh. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:07:11|7:13]]. AT: "Pharaoh became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues to speak to Pharaoh through Moses.

tn.ref: the land was ruined because of the swarms of flies
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the swarms of flies devastated the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This was a customary way of saying "in the presence of someone." AT: "in their presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Moses asks this question to show Pharaoh the Egyptians would allow the Israelites to worship Yahweh. AT: "they will certainly stone us!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: you must not deal deceitfully any more by not letting our people go
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "you must begin to deal truthfully with us and let our people go" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: But you must not deal deceitfully
tn.text: "But you must not deceive us" or "But you must not lie to us"

Here "heart" refers to Pharaoh. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:07:11|7:13]]. AT: "Pharaoh became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
